revisions.rev:
The '''William & Mary Tribe women's soccer''' teams represent [[The College of William & Mary]] in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] competition. Located in [[Williamsburg, Virginia]], United States, the women's soccer program began its official participation as a varsity sport in 1981. The first head coach was [[John Charles (soccer)|John Charles]], who led the program for five seasons and compiled a 50â29â11 overall record. In 1986, [[England|Englishman]] [[John Daly (soccer coach)|John Daly]] took over and continued on his predecessor's success. Daly is still the head coach through the 2009 season. Starting in 1984, the Tribe earned berths into the [[NCAA Women's Soccer Championship]] in every season for the rest of the 1980s. In 1987 and 1989 they made their way to the Elite 8, making them one of only eight teams remaining in the college soccer season. {| id="toc" border="0" ! {{MediaWiki:Toc}}: |[[#1981|1981]] - [[#1982|1982]] - [[#1983|1983]] - [[#1984|1984]] - [[#1985|1985]] - [[#1986|1986]] - [[#1987|1987]] - [[#1988|1988]] - [[#1989|1989]] |} __NOTOC__ ==1981== {{Infobox |name = Infobox/doc |bodystyle = |title = |titlestyle = |image = |caption = |captionstyle = |headerstyle = background:#FFFFFF; |labelstyle = background:#FFFFFF; |label1 = Head coach |data1 = [[John Charles (soccer)|John Charles]] (1st year) |label2 = Overall record |data2 = 9â8â0 |label3 = Conference record |data3 = N/A |label4 = Goals scored |data4 = 41 |label5 = Goals against |data5 = 41 |belowstyle = background:#FFFFFF; |below = None   '''<< Seasons >>'''   [[1982 William & Mary Tribe women's soccer team|1982]] }} {| class="wikitable" |- !
